Dip the fish in the butter and coat on all sides.
Transfer fish to tortilla crumbs and cover with crumbs, pressing the crumbs in as necessary.
After fish is coated. Place on a baking sheet with lightly oiled parchment paper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, until cooked through.
Serve immediately, top fish with a spoonful of salsa and a dollop of crema.

name: Sweet Potato Tart with Candied Bacon and Caramel Sauce
instructions: To make candy bacon:Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Arrange bacon strips in large rimmed baking pan. Bake until browned, about 15 minutes. Pour off bacon fat. Brush bacon with half of syrup. Bake until glazed, about 3 minutes. Flip bacon over, brush other side, and bake until glazed, 3 minutes more.Immediately transfer bacon to a plate to cool completely (bacon crisp when cooled).Coarsely chop the bacon. (Bacon can be prepared up to 2 hours ahead; do not refrigerate.)

To make the tart crust: Lightly butter a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom. In medium bowl, add flour, brown sugar and salt and stir to combine. Add butter. Using pastry blender or two knives, cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse meal.Stir in beaten egg to make soft dough. Firmly and evenly press dough into tart pan. Freeze for 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.Place tart on baking sheet and bake until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven.Keep oven on.

To make the filling: Drain sweet potatoes, reserving 1/4 cup syrup. Using food processor, process sweet potatoes until mashed. Add brown sugar, yogurt, flour, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon and cloves and pulse to combine. Add milk and egg whites and process, scraping down sides of bowl, until smooth. Pour into crust.

Bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees F. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F. Bake until filling is lightly and evenly puffed and jiggles as a unit when pan is shaken lightly, 45 to 50 minutes. Transfer to wire rack and cool completely. (The tart can be covered and refrigerated for up to 1 day.)

To make caramel sauce: In medium heavy saucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to boil over high heat, stirring constantly. When boiling, stop stirring and cook, occasionally swirling the pan by its handle and washing down any crystals on the sides with a bristle brush dipped in water, until syrup is smoking and the color of an old penny, 3 to 5 minutes. You will not need a candy thermometer—judge the caramel by its color. Reduce heat to low. Carefully and slowly stir in warm cream (it will foam up) and mix until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and salt.Let cool.Makes about 3/4 cup sauce.(The sauce can be cooled, covered, and refrigerated for up to 1 day.Reheat before serving.)
To serve: Remove tart pan sides. Cut into wedges, spoon sauce over each serving and sprinkle with chopped candy bacon.

name: Pork Roast with Sweet Potatoes, Pears and Rosemary

ingredients.prep: center roast, bone-in, excess fat trimmed to thin layer*
ingredients.name: pork loin

ingredients.prep: chopped, plus more for serving, or 1 teaspoon of dried rosemary
ingredients.name: fresh rosemary

ingredients.prep: 6 medium, peeled, and cut lengthwise into sixths
ingredients.name: sweet potatoes

ingredients.prep: firm-ripe, cut lengthwise into quarters, cored
ingredients.name: bosc pears

instructions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Rub pork all over with oil. Mix rosemary, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in small bowl. Rub all over pork.

Place pork, bone side down, in large flameproof roasting pan. Roast 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F. Roast 15 minutes more. Add sweet potatoes and pears to pan, stir gently to coat with pan juices, and spread as evenly as possible around roast. Season with salt and pepper. Roast, occasionally stirring sweet potato mixture, until instant-read food thermometer inserted in center of roast reads 145 degrees F and the potatoes and pears are tender, about 1 hour more. Transfer pork to carving board. Transfer sweet potato mixture to ovenproof bowl, tent with aluminum foil, and keep warm in turned-off oven. (If needed, increase oven temperature to 400 degrees F, and continue roasting sweet potato mixture until tender, up to 15 minutes longer.) Let pork stand for 10 to 15 minutes.
Heat roasting pan over high heat. Add cider, bring to a boil, scraping up browned bits in pan with wooden spoon, and boil until reduced to 3/4 cup, about 5 minutes. Pour into sauceboat.
Carve pork. Transfer to serving platter, surround with sweet potato mixture, drizzle with 3 tablespoons of cider sauce, and sprinkle with rosemary. Serve with remaining sauce on the side.

*Tip: If you desire to tie the roast, cotton kitchen twine (also called butcher's twine) is handy to have on hand for a number of chores, especially tying roasts to help them keep their shape during cooking. If you don't have it, use unwaxed and unflavored dental floss.
**Substitute 1 cup apple juice and 1/2 cup dry vermouth for the hard cider, or use all apple juice.

name: Ginger and Cinnamon Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees celsius.
Combine the flour, sugar, ginger, and cinnamon and mix well.
Form a hole in the middle of the mix and place the butter and the egg.
Work the mix with your hands until it becomes a malleable dough that you can form into a ball.
Wrap the cookie dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate it for about 30 minutes.
Place the cookie dough on a floured surface and flatten it using a rolling pin.
Cut out the cookies in the desired shapes.
Brush them lightly with egg white and dip them in sugar.
Bake the cookies for approximately 20 minutes.

name: Spaghetti with Tomato and Bologna Sausage
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Boil water in a large cooking pot, cook the spaghetti for 7 minutes, and then strain.
Mix the spaghetti with the bologna, a dash of olive oil, tomatoes, and salt and pepper to taste in a large bowl.
Place a layer of parchment paper on a cooking tray and place 4 portions of spaghetti on the tray.
Form a space in the middle of each portion by using a fork and doing circle shapes, until they look like nests.
Place 1 egg on each nest, sprinkle the Parmesan cheese and butter cubes on top, and bake for 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and serve with sprinkled parsley on top.

name: Penne with Eggplant Cavair and Crushed Tomatoes
instructions: Cook the pasta al dente in boiling salted water.
In a skillet on low heat, add the eggplant cavier and cream. Mix until warm.
Wash and chop the tomato.
Once the penne is cooked, place it on a plate, pour the eggplant and cream sauce on top, and garnish with diced tomatoes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with grated parmesan cheese.

name: Baked Scallops
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Place the scallops in salty water to release any traces of sand. Clean thoroughly. Do not discard the shells.
Add the oil to a skillet on medium heat. Saute the shallot until golden brown, about 8 minutes.
Add the ham and stir. Cook for a minute, and then add the wine and a pinch of parsley. Cook for 10 minutes.
Put the scallop and the filling in the shell and sprinkle breadcrumbs on top.
Place the shells on a baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes.

name: Oatmeal Raisin and Blueberry Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius.
Mix the butter and brown sugar in a bowl with an electric mixer until the ingredients are creamy.
On a separate bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, oats, and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl mix the milk and yogurt.
Add the eggs and honey to the bowl with the sugar and butter mixture.
Add the dry ingredients to milk/yogurt mixture. Add the butter/sugar mixture and stir well.
Add the raisins and blueberries and mix everything together.
Place muffin cups into a muffin baking sheet and pour in the batter in each section.
Lower the heat from the oven to 180 C.
Place the muffin pan into the oven and bake for 15 minutes.

name: Vegan Garlic Bread

ingredients.prep: or ciabatta bread, 16 oz. per loaf, sliced in half lengthwise
ingredients.name: loaf Italian bread

ingredients.prep: chopped, ex: chives, parsley, thyme, for serving
ingredients.name: fresh herbs

instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Line a sheet pan with aluminum foil. Arrange the bread halves cut side up on the prepared sheet pan.
Place the softened buttery spread and garlic in a medium bowl. Stir until thoroughly mixed.
Spread the butter mixture evenly on the bread halves.
Bake the garlic bread on the middle rack of the oven, rotating the pan once during the cooking time, until the garlic bread is light golden brown at the edges, 12-18 minutes.
Check to see that garlic bread is done.Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Remove the sheet pan from the oven. Cut the bread into 2- or 3-inch-wide slices and serve garnished with fresh herbs, if desired.

name: Nutella and Orange Cake Pops
instructions: Preheat oven to 175 degrees Celsius.
Mix the butter, sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, orange zest, and eggs (adding them one by one) in a large bowl.
Mix the white flour, yeast, and orange juice in a different bowl.
Add the flour to the large bowl and mix until you obtain dough.
Place the dough in a cake mold and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and let it sit overnight.
Beat the butter in a medium bowl until it obtains a foamy texture.
Add the Nutella, Philadelphia cheese, and Nesquik chocolate powder to the butter and stir until all the ingredients are completely mixed.
Undo the cake using your hands and form crumbs. Place them in a large bowl.
Add the cream to the bowl and mix.
Form dough balls about 30 grams each and place one Cake Pop stick on each ball. Let them sit in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.
Place the melted dark chocolate in a medium bowl and dip each Cake Pop in it, then garnish it with chocolate candy sprinkles and place on a layer of parchment paper.
Serve once the chocolate cover dries.

name: Neapolitan Pastiera Pie
instructions: Prepare the pie crust by kneading together the flour, eggs, sugar, lard, and the lemon peel.
Refrigerate the dough until it is to be used.
Cook the wheat in a medium saucepan with the milk, lard, and the sugar over low heat until it is creamy in consistency.
Allow it to cool completely.

Place the ricotta cheese in a large bowl and stir with a wooden spoon until it is creamy. Add the sugar and continue stirring. Add the egg yolks and 3 egg whites, the grated peel of 2 lemons, orange flower water, vanilla extract, and candied fruits.
Add the cooked wheat cream and stir to incorporate well.
BUtter and flour a pie plate. Roll out the pie crust to a thickness of 3 millimeters and line the pie plate. Set aside some of the dough to make strips for the lattice on top of the pie.
Fill the pie crust with the pie filling, make a lattice pattern with the strips of dough set aside earlier, and add them to the top of the pie.
Bake the pie at approximately 150C for approximately 2 hours, the pie crust should be golden and the filling should not be liquid.
Turn off the oven and let the pie cool inside with the door slightly open.
Refrigerate the cake for 3 days, serve it sprinkled with powdered sugar.

name: Fiesta Tostadas

ingredients.name: shredded reduced fat Mexican cheese blend

instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F.  Cut sausage into 1/4" slices; set aside.   Arrange tortillas on 2 baking sheets.  Bake tortillas 5 minutes, turn and bake 3-4 minutes longer.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Add sausage and cook, stirring frequently for 3-4 minutes or until lightly browned.   Remove from pan and drain.
Top tortillas with lettuce, tomatoes, avocados, onion, sausage, cheese and salsa.

name: Cherry Sponge Cake with Cinnamon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 Celsius and grease a medium-sized baking pan.
Use a hand mixer to beat the butter until fluffy, and add the sugar slowly until creamy.
Add the eggs, beat for a few more minutes, and then add the flour, cinnamon, and baking powder. Beat for a few more minutes.
Pour the batter into the pan. Divide each cherry into four pieces, and place on top of the batter, cut side down. Sprinkle the lime juice onto the cherries and sprinkle with the tablespoon of sugar.
Bake for 45 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Let cool 10 minutes, and then remove from pan.

name: Greek Yogurt and Chocolate Pavlova
instructions: Preheat the oven to 140 degrees Celsius.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and draw 14 centimeter diameter circles on it.
In a bowl, whisk the egg whites into stiff peaks slowly adding in the sugar. When they are firm and shiny, whisk in the cornstarch and vinegar.
Spoon the egg whites onto the preprinted circles and bake them 30 minutes until lightly golden.
In the meantime, make the yogurt cream. Whisk the heavy cream into stiff peaks and fold in the Greek yogurt. Reserve in the refrigerator.
Remove the pavlovas from the oven and set aside to cool.
In a microwave-safe bowl, add the dark chocolate and milk. On medium power, microwave the mixture 1 minute. Stir and repeat until completely melted.
Serve the pavlovas with the chocolate sauce and yogurt cream on top and sprinkled with crushed almonds.
